page.title: 11Middlezoy C P School
page.content: Middlezoy County Primary School was opened in February 1875. It is still in the same building, but there have been some additions such as a temporary mobile classroom. In July 1985 there were 48 children in the school. The infant children are taught by Mrs Crosier and the Junior children by the Headteacher, Mr Hamlin. For one day a week the juniors are taught by Mr Wannell so that the headteacher can deal with the administrative work. The school is built of brick. There are two rooms and the cloakroom in the main building. There used to be a house for the head but that has now been converted to make offices for the head and the secretary and a woodwork room, a kitchen and a music practice room for the use of children. The school uses the Community Playing Field for sports and games.
